src/lib/components/WordDash.react.js.description:
WordDash is a component that displays a cloud of words.
The size of each word is determined by its frequency.
Clicking on a word selects it, dimming all other words
and outlining the selected word in black.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

words.description:
Dictionary of words and their counts.
Format: { word1: count1, word2: count2, ... }

width.description: Width of the worddash container in pixels.

height.description: Height of the worddash container in pixels.

fontSizeRange.description:
Range of font sizes to use for the words.
Format: [minSize, maxSize]

fontFamily.description: Font family to use for the words.

rotationAngles.description:
Array of possible rotation angles in degrees.
Words will be randomly rotated to one of these angles.

colorScheme.description:
Color scheme to use for the words.
Can be either a string (Plotly/d3 color scheme name) or an array of colors.
When an array is provided, colors are interpolated across the frequency range
(lowest count gets first color, highest count gets last color).

customColors.description:
Custom colors for specific words.
JSON string with word as key and color as value.

clickData.description:
Data about the clicked word.
Format: { word: string, count: number }

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.
